event_text: m_c thinks about retiring.
m_c travels to o_c to bring them an important message.
m_c travels to the other Clans to bring them an important message.
As the deputy, m_c is doing {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} best to prepare for leadership in the case that the worst happens.

m_c is struggling to accept the fact that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} may have to step up as leader if r_c loses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} last life. How could {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/go/goes} on without {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} beloved leader? How difficult will it to be to lead in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} stead?
m_c is struggling to accept the fact that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} may have to step up as leader if r_c loses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} last life.
m_c is heavily relying on the tactical advice and experience of the elders, namely r_c.
m_c disappears for a few days, then returns to camp with a acc_singular around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.
m_c, after meeting a kittypet on the border, comes back to camp disgruntled, ruffled, and with a collar around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.
m_c gifts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} beloved r_c with a acc_singular to wear in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} pelt.
m_c gives r_c a singular_acc to make up for a bad fight between them.
m_c and r_c take a late night patrol out of camp to watch the sun rise. m_c comes back flustered, and with a new accessory -- a gift from r_c!
m_c and r_c take an early evening patrol out of camp to watch the moon rise. m_c comes back flustered, and with a new accessory -- a gift from r_c!
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step and a new flowery accessory!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty flower! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.
m_c finds a cool stick near the edge of camp! m_c decides it's cool enough to keep around.

r_c finds a cool stick while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to carry it around.
Mysteriously, it seems like m_c has found a small pumpkin near camp. m_c decides to roll it around with them around camp.

r_c finds a weird little pumpkin while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to roll it around.
After a warm stroll in the leaf-broken sunlight, m_c comes back with moss in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} jaws. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} seem oddly possessive over it.

m_c and r_c decide to go on a warm, sunkissed stroll together to fetch some moss. m_c finds a specifically enamouring patch of moss, to r_c's amusement, and decides to bring it back home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head at the camp wall. Nobody's entirely sure why... until {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/pluck/plucks} a few ivy leaves off of the wall, and wear it with pride.

r_c finds a cool ivy-covered tree while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} a pair of pretty leaves back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to wear it.
m_c spots an oak tree dropping acorns, and decided to take and wear one.
After m_c gets bonked on the head by a towering oak tree's falling acorns, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decide to take and wear one out of pure spite.

In the cool autumn air, m_c and r_c go on a short stroll together... and it's not too long until an acorn thunks onto the back of m_c's head. At r_c's cackles at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} disgruntled, embarrassed face, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decide to take the acorn and wear it out of pure spite.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step... and with a new noodly, harmless friend!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers to show {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a cool, silly little snake {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found! m_c takes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} invitation. After seeing the weird, harmless thing, m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c gently guides a acc_singular into camp. Seems like m_c has found a new friend?
r_c and m_c, on a walk together, stumble upon an acc_singular. m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head, and decides to take it home! r_c is charmed by m_c's generosity.

m_c waltzes onto camp with a acc_singular following suit! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/snap/snaps} at any cat who attempts to snap at the poor thing, and m_c proudly states that it's {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new pet.
m_c sneaks out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after they attempt to leave!
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after they attempt to leave!
m_c leaps up at a flying bug {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} found around camp, and catches it with grace! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the acc_display proudly.
r_c mrrps at m_c, asking {PRONOUN/m_c/object} if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} wanted a pair of acc_singular that they found. m_c says yes, and thanks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for the cool wings!
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, happily sharing how m_c managed to keep a snail as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pet.
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a cute, slowly moving snail! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c coos at the little thing as m_c carries it home.
m_c seems to have found a strange bug, and has decided to keep it as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a strange bug, and calls m_c over to see it. Curiously enough, m_c has decided to keep it as a pet.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head idly at a bee flying around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head. It doesn't seem to want to sting {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, so m_c assumes it wants to be {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friend!
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a bee! m_c claims it's {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new pet.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c calls from behind m_c, and m_c has to leap out of the way of a buzzing bee! m_c shifts to swipe at it... but r_c remarks that it seems oddly friendly. m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a fruity smelling acc_singular! m_c flaunts their new acc_singular with grace.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a cool acc_singular bush {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to take and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a cherry tree {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot from a ways away! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to tread over and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.

m_c almost steps on a pristine, white bird skull that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} managed to miss seeing. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/take/takes} it with curious eyes, and {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} it proudly.
